item.title: Had a great time talking to @ridd_design We covered a whole range of language-model-related topics: short and long term design & eng implications, multi-modal models, the design engineering debate, proactive models and agents, and a touch of digital gardening at the end.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
Had a great time talking to @ridd_design
We covered a whole range of language-model-related topics: short and long term design & eng implications, multi-modal models, the design engineering debate, proactive models and agents, and a touch of digital gardening at the end.

nitter.privacydev.net/ridd_design/status/1801306525727867137#m

Hello, Finland üá´üáÆ

item.title:
More nonsense from me railing against chatbots. Just another Tuesday.
Caveat: sure, we can have *some* useful, open-ended chat-ish interfaces. But most complex, interesting, genuinely important human tasks do not take the shape of asking text boxes to fuzzy search the web
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:

item.title:
Had a delightful chat with @jlengstorf a few weeks ago about my chaotic, unplanned career ‚Äústrategy‚Äù
Talked about liberally switching directions, learning a broad range of skills, and not setting goals beyond 6 months.
Works for me, but YMMV üòé

item.title:
2,900km / 0km
Finally had to retire my lovely orange Merrell Trail Glove running shoes.
Swapping them out for a pair of Xero HFS II. Super bright. Super comfy.
(Yes I know you‚Äôre not ‚Äúsupposed‚Äù to put that many kilometres on a single pair. But my rule is no holes, no problems)
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:

item.title:
R to @Mappletons: Small, specific conferences with <150 people united by a philosophy, rather than a specific technology, are magical. Especially when you're united by trying to bring something into being.
Drastically different vibes from 300+ person confs focused on X language, tool, or library
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
Small, specific conferences with <150 people united by a philosophy, rather than a specific technology, are magical. Especially when you're united by trying to bring something into being.

Drastically different vibes from 300+ person confs focused on X language, tool, or library

item.title:
R to @Mappletons: I assumed a lot of knowledge about local-first philosophy given the audience.
If you need to catch-up, here's the canonical essay on it: https://www.inkandswitch.com/local-first/
Before coming into this conf I only had an amateur understanding of the movement, but I'm pretty much pilled now.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
I assumed a lot of knowledge about local-first philosophy given the audience.

If you need to catch-up, here's the canonical essay on it: inkandswitch.com/local-first‚Ä¶

item.title:
Just finished up an intense but wonderful few days at @localfirstconf.
Did a new talk on why language models making software development faster, easier, and cheaper will create a golden age of home-cooked software & barefoot developers.
Slides and transcript belowüëá
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
Just finished up an intense but wonderful few days at @localfirstconf.

Did a new talk on why language models making software development faster, easier, and cheaper will create a golden age of home-cooked software & barefoot developers.

Slides and transcript belowüëá

item.title:
Heading to Berlin for @localfirstconf later this week. Hopefully see some of you there ‚Äì come say hi.
Doing a talk on the coming wave of home-cooked software and barefoot developers & how we can bake local-first into it
Suffering to make this good rn but ü§û I'll pull it off

item.title: R to @Mappletons: Making reasonable, defensible claims and backing them up with mountains of evidence is the love of my life and the bane of my existence.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description: Making reasonable, defensible claims and backing them up with mountains of evidence is the love of my life and the bane of my existence.

item.title:
In the pain and suffering stage of pulling a complex argument together into a coherent structure.
But noticing I‚Äôm better at tolerating it. Or at least I‚Äôve done enough reps that I‚Äôm able to watch part of me start to panic, and can reassure myself I don‚Äôt need to.
Instead I can calmly throw out my existing material and try to reconstruct the argument again from the ground up.
Growth, or something.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:

item.title:
RT by @Mappletons: One day downloading a single purpose "app" that you cannot augment will be a retro novelty.
Half the crowd will mock it and the other half will sing it's praises for having an opinionated design and helping them focus on doing one thing well.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
One day downloading a single purpose "app" that you cannot augment will be a retro novelty.

Half the crowd will mock it and the other half will sing it's praises for having an opinionated design and helping them focus on doing one thing well.

item.title: As the iconic Golden Gate Bridge, surrounded by a thick morning fog, I feel the recent feats of modern engineering, architecture, and prototyping are arriving too fast to reasonably manage. Please refrain from publishing any new astonishing sights and sounds until I can work through these ~80 tabs.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
As the iconic Golden Gate Bridge, surrounded by a thick morning fog, I feel the recent feats of modern engineering, architecture, and prototyping are arriving too fast to reasonably manage.
Please refrain from publishing any new astonishing sights and sounds until I can work through these ~80 tabs.

item.title: R to @Mappletons: This is the kind of information-dense, birds-eye-view explanation I wish I could write... were I able to pull my nose away from any of the very specific trees in this dark, endless forest.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description: This is the kind of information-dense, birds-eye-view explanation I wish I could write... were I able to pull my nose away from any of the very specific trees in this dark, endless forest.
